item.title: How To Emulate Persistent Memory using the Linux "memmap" Kernel Option
item.description: Applies To This document applies to Linux distributions and versions that support persistent memory. Introduction The Linux pmem driver allows application developers to begin developing persistent memory enabled applications using memory mapped files residing on Direct Access Filesystems (DAX) such as EXT4 and XFS. A memmap kernel option was added that supports reserving one or more ranges of unassigned memory for use with emulated persistent memory. The memmap parameter documentation can be found at https://www.
